title: Meet the family offices backing property float HomeCo
text:
There’ll be no institutional investors on property play Home Consortium’s register when it starts trading on Monday – but there are plenty of heavyweights.

Family offices from Sydney and Melbourne piled into the $325 million initial public offering, so much so that former banker David Di Pilla and his board didn’t have to meet a fund manager as part of the float marketing.

Expect the who's who of Sydney and Melbourne's business community to be present and correct as the bell rings on HomeCo's ASX debut on Monday. Peter Braig

It is understood the biggest bets came from a handful of HomeCo’s cornerstone backers, who bid early and bid strong. And with the company set to hit the ASX boards at 1pm on Monday, Street Talk can reveal some of the names in the cornerstone group.

There’s the Oatley family, worth more than $1 billion according to the AFR Rich List, who are best known for owning wineries, islands and the like, and another Rich Lister in John Symond of Aussie Home Loans fame.

Also representing the Rich List is Nigel Austin, who founded and owns the Cotton On Group and is worth close to $2 billion, and the Besen family, also worth about $2 billion thanks to some shrewd retail sector investments.
description: There’ll be no institutional investors on HomeCo's register when it starts trading, but there are heavyweights.
